title: Understanding Your Risk for Breast Cancer: A Self-Assessment Quiz
description: This self-assessment quiz provides preliminary information about potential risk factors for developing breast cancer. It serves as an informational tool for initial self-evaluation and is not a substitute for professional medical advice.
disclaimer: This quiz is intended for informational purposes only and should not be considered a substitute for professional medical advice. Consult with a healthcare professional for a personalized breast cancer risk assessment.

questions.question: Do you have any first-degree relatives (mother, sister, daughter) who have been diagnosed with breast cancer?

options.text: Yes, one relative diagnosed after age 50
Yes, one relative diagnosed before age 50
Yes, more than one first-degree relative

questions.question: Have you ever been diagnosed with breast cancer?
Have you ever been diagnosed with any of the following benign breast conditions after a biopsy: atypical ductal hyperplasia (ADH) or lobular carcinoma in situ (LCIS)?
Have you ever had genetic testing that showed you have a mutation in the BRCA1 or BRCA2 gene, or another gene associated with increased breast cancer risk?

options.text: Yes, another gene mutation associated with increased risk
Have had genetic testing, but no mutations found

questions.question: Have you been told by your doctor that you have dense breast tissue based on your mammogram?
At what age did you start menstruating?
At what age did you go through menopause (if applicable)?
On average, how many alcoholic drinks do you consume per week?
What is your approximate Body Mass Index (BMI)?
How many hours of moderate-intensity physical activity do you typically engage in per week?
Are you currently taking or have you taken menopausal hormone therapy (HT) for 5 years or more?
At what age did you have your first full-term pregnancy?

options.text: Have never had a full-term pregnancy

questions.question: Have you ever received radiation therapy to your chest area before the age of 30?

scoring.interpretation: Your responses suggest a lower likelihood of having several established risk factors for breast cancer. However, it's important to remember that everyone has some baseline risk, and this quiz does not account for all potential factors. Continue to maintain a healthy lifestyle and follow recommended screening guidelines from your healthcare provider.

Your responses indicate the presence of some risk factors associated with a moderate increase in the likelihood of developing breast cancer. It is advisable to discuss these findings with your healthcare provider for a more personalized risk assessment and to determine appropriate screening strategies.

Your responses suggest the presence of several significant risk factors that may substantially increase your likelihood of developing breast cancer. It is strongly recommended that you consult with your healthcare provider to discuss these findings in detail, undergo a comprehensive risk assessment, and explore appropriate screening and prevention options. This may include earlier or more frequent screenings, genetic counseling, or other risk-reduction strategies.
